ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a ton about Afghanistan and the current crisis there, as well as about the UN system in general. Probably most importantly, I feel like I learned a lot about teamwork and project management, which will be very useful in the future.
I learned a ton about Afghanistan, the UN system, multilateral institutions, international politics and great power relations.
It was a great opportunity to learn how to organize a broad project, improve teamwork, and learn important skills such as interview conducting, etc.

The capstone class and project were the culmination of my Yale journey and it was one of the most profound experiences of my life. Its hard to fully describe everything that I learned and the skills I picked up from this course cannot be put into such few words. My project focused on the UN and Afghanistan and was led by the amazing Dr. Andrew Wilder. With his insights and guidance we produced a report for the United Nations with recommendations for how they should continue their assistance mission in Afghanistan. Beyond learning the context and history of  both the United Nations and Afghanistan. Dr. Wilder introduced us to over 50 individuals who we interviewed and spoke with to gain insights on this space and this topic.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It varies a lot by project, but I only experienced strengths, mainly due to having great group members and an excellent advisor (Dr. Wilder). I super appreciated the opportunity to talk with tons of experts, including traveling to D.C. to conduct interviews, as well as the opportunity to present the project to people at UNAMA and UN delegations.
Main weakness is it depends a lot on the capstone you get.
I can't think of many ways to improve this course because there were no weaknesses with the direction from Dr. Wilder.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I mean, you have to take the capstone for the major, but I would definitely recommend taking it with Dr. Wilder as your advisor for any future students. He organized many of our interviews and gave us a ton of useful advice; I don't know where we'd be without him so if you have the chance to do the capstone with Dr. Wilder in the future, pick his group.
Its a global affairs senior project that wont get offered in the same format again but if it is somehow offered again, yes! I thoroughly enjoyed my experience.
Definitely. A great opportunity to get a glimpse of what your career life may be.

I recommend Global Affairs, the capstone, and most specifically, a project led by Dr. Wilder wholeheartedly. If given the opportunity to take a capstone class with Dr. Wilder take it! It was one of the best experiences during my time at Yale!
